sgraph

Interface INode

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNode, GroupNode, LeafNode, TransformNode

    public interface INode
    This interface represents all the operations offered by any type of node in our scenegraph. Not all types of nodes are able to offer all types of operations. This is implemented by the AbstractNode throwing an exception for all such methods, and appropriate nodes overriding these methods
    Author:
    Amit Shesh

      • getNode

        INode getNode(java.lang.String name)
        In the scene graph rooted at this node, get the node whose name is as given
        Parameters:
        name - name of node to be searched
        Returns:
        the node reference if it exists, null otherwise

      • draw

        void draw(IScenegraphRenderer context,
        java.util.Stack<org.joml.Matrix4f> modelView)
        Draw the scene graph rooted at this node, using the modelview stack and context
        Parameters:
        context - the generic renderer context IScenegraphRenderer
        modelView - the stack of modelview matrices

      • clone

        INode clone()
        Return a deep copy of the scene graph subtree rooted at this node
        Returns:
        a reference to the root of the copied subtree

      • setParent

        void setParent(INode parent)
        Set the parent of this node. Each node except the root has a parent
        Parameters:
        parent - the node that is to be the parent of this node

      • setScenegraph

        void setScenegraph(IScenegraph graph)
        Traverse the scene graph rooted at this node, and store references to the scenegraph object
        Parameters:
        graph - a reference to the scenegraph object of which this tree is a part

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name of this node. The name is not guaranteed to be unique in the tree, but it should be.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this node

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this node
        Returns:
        the name of this node

      • addChild

        void addChild(INode node)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a child to this node. Not all types of nodes have the capability of having children. If the node cannot have a child, this method throws an IllegalArgumentException}
        Parameters:
        node - the node that must be added as a child to this node
        Throws:
        {@link - }IllegalArgumentException} if this node is unable to have children (i.e. leaves)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • setTransform

        void setTransform(org.joml.Matrix4f m)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the transformation associated with this node. Not all types of nodes can have transformations. If the node cannot store a transformation, this method throws an IllegalArgumentException}
        Parameters:
        m - the tranformation matrix associated with this transformation
        Throws:
        {@link - }IllegalArgumentException} if this node is unable to store a transformation (all nodes except TransformNode)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • setMaterial

        void setMaterial(Material m)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the material associated with this node. Not all types of nodes can have materials associated with them. If the node cannot have a material, this method throws an IllegalArgumentException}
        Parameters:
        m - the material object to be associated with this node
        Throws:
        {@link - }IllegalArgumentException} if this node is unable to store a material (all nodes except leaves)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
